title: Styling up creative costumes
text:
Lifestyle Cairns State High School gears up for CAD Wearable Art Parade by: What are these? COLOURFUL CONTENDERS: Isabella Demartini, 16, Denzel Kennedy, 18, and Sara Haruta, 16, give the art a workout. PICTURE: ANNA ROGERS Source: News Limited 
FROM feathers to film, nothing is off limits in the world of wearable art and Cairns high school students have been letting their imaginations run wild. 
Cairns State High School will this weekend host the 29th annual Centre of Artistic Development Wearable Art Parade, which will feature 90 entries across four categories. 
Year 12 student Isabella Demartini is set to be a strong contender after spending the past eight months creating 17 garments inspired by her favourite movies and Rio Carnival. 
“I’ve used feathers, curtains, lace, film, tablecloths, spray-paint, wire and sequins – pretty much anything I could get my hands on at the op shop,” she said. 
The wearable art parade will run from 6.15pm on Saturday at Crosswell Hall, Cairns State High. 
Tickets cost $15 for adults and $10 for concession, and include refreshments. 
They can be bought at the school office or on the door.
